revision.text:
{{For|the football player|Todd Berry}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Todd Barry | image = Todd Barry.jpg | imagesize = 230 px | caption = Barry in January 2017 | pseudonym = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1964|3|26}} | birth_place = [[The Bronx, New York]] | death_date = | death_place = | medium = Stand-up | active = 1984–present | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | notable_work= | signature = | website = {{official website|http://www.toddbarry.com}} | footnotes = }}
'''Todd Barry''' (March 26, 1964) is an American [[stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]], actor, and voice actor.<ref name="zinoman2012">Zinoman, Jason (March 21, 2012). [https://www.nytimes.com/2012/03/22/arts/television/todd-barry-at-carolines-comedy-club.html How a Master of Stand-Up Sells the Joke.] ''[[New York Times]]''</ref> He is known for [[deadpan]] comedy.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tucsonweekly.com/tucson/deadpan-laughs/Content?oid=3349597|title=Deadpan Laughs|last=Mendex|first=David|work=[[Tucson Weekly]]|date=10 May 2012|accessdate=3 November 2015}}</ref>
==Life and career== [[File:Toddbarry_zanies.JPG|thumb|right|Barry at Zanies in February 2006]]Barry was born in [[The Bronx]], New York, and grew up in Florida.<ref name="OFFICIAL WEBSITE">[http://www.toddbarry.com/bio.html Todd Barry Bio] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110609071229/http://www.toddbarry.com/bio.html |date=2011-06-09 }} Accessed June 21, 2011.</ref> He graduated from the [[University of Florida]] with a degree in English in 1986.<ref name="UF Alumni Profile">[http://www.clas.ufl.edu/alumni/alumninotes/09spring/clasact.html Todd Barry Alumni Page] Accessed July 22, 2014.</ref> Before starting in stand-up comedy, he first worked as a drummer in the indie rock band [[The Chant]] from 1984 to 1985. In 1999, his ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]'' aired. He wrote, directed and starred in the short film ''Borrowing Saffron'' (2002), which co-starred [[H. Jon Benjamin]]. He has made a variety of guest appearances on shows like ''[[Dr. Katz, Professional Therapist]]'', ''[[Home Movies (TV series)|Home Movies]]'', ''[[Wonder Showzen]]'', ''[[Tom Goes to the Mayor]]'', and ''[[Aqua Teen Hunger Force]]''. He also voices a recurring character on [[Squidbillies]]. In 2004, Todd Barry was featured in an animated series called ''[[Shorties Watchin' Shorties]]''.<ref name="OFFICIAL WEBSITE"/><ref name="Shorties">[http://www.atom.com/funny_videos/shorties_barry_prison/ Todd Barry Shortie's] Accessed July 2, 2011.</ref>
In 2008, he played Wayne in Darren Aronofsky's ''[[The Wrestler (2008 film)|The Wrestler]]''.
Over the course of six years he made 16 appearances on ''[[Dr. Katz]]'', appearing as himself in the first two appearances. He then played the recurring character "Todd the video store clerk" and appeared in most episodes in the show's final year. He also played a character in the television pilot ''[[Saddle Rash]]'' along with [[Sarah Silverman]], [[H. Jon Benjamin]] and [[Mitch Hedberg]]. In "[[The Third Conchord]]", the twelfth and final episode of the first season of ''[[Flight of the Conchords (TV series)|Flight of the Conchords]]'', Barry played Todd, a bongo playing megalomaniac, who tries to introduce the song "Doggy Bounce" to the Conchords' repertoire, and a new band name: The Crazy Dogggz.
In 2010, Barry had a recurring role as a fictionalized version of himself in the second season of the live-action [[Adult Swim]] series ''[[Delocated]]'' - in which he is a frequent associate of the Russian mafia characters, casually playing card games with them in their club. He also had a recurring role playing himself in FX's ''[[Louie (U.S. TV series)|Louie]]''.
In 2012, Barry released the album and special [[Super Crazy (album)|''Super Crazy'']] on [[Comedy Central Records]].<ref>{{cite web|last=L. Ray|first=Austin|title=Todd Barry Super Crazy album review|url=http://www.thespittake.com/2012/07/20/todd-barry-super-crazy-comedy-centra/|publisher=The Spit Take|accessdate=10 April 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Jeffries|first=David|title=Super Crazy – Todd Barry|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/super-crazy-mw0002387784|publisher=AllMusic|accessdate=10 April 2013}}</ref>
In 2014, Barry was featured on Season 3, Episode 4 of Jerry Seinfeld's web show ''[[Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.crackle.com/c/comedians-in-cars-getting-coffee|title=Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee|last=|first=|date=|website=www.crackle.com|access-date=2018-07-20}}</ref>
==Works==
===Discography=== * ''Medium Energy'' (2001) * ''Falling off the Bone'' (2004) * ''From Heaven'' (2008)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/11945-from-heaven/|title=Todd Barry – From Heaven – Comedy Central 2008|publisher=[[Pitchfork Media]]|date=June 8, 2008|accessdate=June 10, 2011}}</ref> * ''[[Super Crazy (album)|Super Crazy]]'' (2012) * ''Todd Barry: The Crowd Work Tour'' (2014) * ''Spicy Honey'' (2017)
===Films=== * ''[[Who's the Caboose?]]'' (1997) – Football Player * ''Tomorrow Night'' (1998) – Man Caught in Rain (Director: Louis CK, 1998 Sundance selection) * ''[[Los Enchiladas!]]'' (1999) – Duane (Director: Mitch Hedberg, 1999 Sundance selection) * ''[[Road Trip (film)|Road Trip]]'' (2000) – Campus Security Guard 1 * ''[[Pootie Tang]]'' (2001) – Greasy * ''Borrowing Saffron'' (2002) – George (Director: Todd Barry, Woodstock Film Festival selection) * ''[[Beer League]]'' (2006) – Creepy Guy Down the Shore * ''[[The Wrestler (2008 film)|The Wrestler]]'' (2008) – Wayne * ''[[Pete Smalls Is Dead]]'' (2010) – Bob Withers * ''[[Vamps (film)|Vamps]]'' (2012) – Ivan * ''[[Wanderlust (2012 film)|Wanderlust]]'' (2012) – Sherm * ''Todd Barry: The Crowd Work Tour'' (2014)  - Himself * "Spicy Honey" (2017)  - Himself
===Television===
* ''[[Aqua Teen Hunger Force]]'', [[List of minor characters in Aqua Teen Hunger Force#Romulox|Romulox]] (three episodes) * ''[[Dr. Katz, Professional Therapist]]'' – Himself * ''[[At Home with Amy Sedaris]]'' – Handley * ''[[Bored to Death]]'' – Dale Woodley * ''[[Flight of the Conchords (TV series)|Flight of the Conchords]]'' – Todd * ''[[Wonder Showzen]]'' – Barold T. Mosley * ''[[Sesame Street]]'' – #7 * ''[[Lucky Louie]]'' – Todd * ''[[Talkshow with Spike Feresten]]'' – Himself-guest * ''[[Chappelle's Show]]'' – Paul * ''[[The Larry Sanders Show]]'' – Keith * ''[[Spin City]]'' – Doug * ''[[Sex and the City]]'' – Ordinary Guy * ''[[Contest Searchlight]]'' – himself * ''[[Tough Crowd With Colin Quinn]]'' – regular panelist * ''[[Tom Goes to the Mayor]]'' – Saul * ''[[Space Ghost Coast to Coast]]'' – Himself-guest ("Eat a Peach" episode) * ''[[Home Movies (TV Series)|Home Movies]]'' – Video Store Clerk * ''[[Lucy, the Daughter of the Devil]]'' * ''[[The Sarah Silverman Program]]'' – Nathan * ''[[Louie (U.S. TV series)|Louie]]'' – Fictional Version of Himself * ''[[Delocated]]'' – Himself * ''[[Bob's Burgers]]'' – Moo-Lissa * ''[[Deadbeat (TV series)|Deadbeat]]'' – Daniel L. Turner * ''[[Master of None]]'' - Todd
===Books===
* ''Thank You for Coming to Hattiesburg'' (2017)
===Podcast appearances===
*''[[WTF with Marc Maron]]'' - (Episode 11) October 8, 2009 *''[[You Made It Weird with Pete Holmes|You Made it Weird with Pete Holmes]]'' - (Episode 33) March 21, 2012 *''WTF with Marc Maron'' - (Episode 486) April 7, 2014 *''[[The Nerdist Podcast]] with Chris Hardwick'' - (Episode 501) April 4, 2014 *''Hang Out With Me with Myq Kaplan'' - November 19, 2012. * ''TV Guidance Counselor'' podcast with [[Ken Reid (comedian)|Ken Reid]] - December 2, 2015. *''[[The Best Show with Tom Scharpling]]'' - March 29, 2017.
In April 2013 Barry started his own eponymous podcast, ''The Todd Barry Podcast''.
